wikipedia_page.main: Eamon Martin KC*HS (born 30 October 1961) is an Irish prelate of the Catholic Church who has been Archbishop of Armagh and the Primate of All Ireland since 2014.

response: At present the Archbishop of Armagh in the Catholic Church is Eamon Martin. John McDowell holds the equivalent office in the Church of Ireland. The current Catholic Archbishop of Dublin is Dermot Farrell. The current Church of Ireland Archbishop of Dublin is Michael Jackson.

On 8 September 2014 it was announced that the Pope had accepted Cardinal Brady's resignation effective that day; Brady was automatically and immediately succeeded by his coadjutor, Archbishop Eamon Martin.

In response to a 2010 request Brady made for the appointment of a coadjutor, on 18 January 2013 Pope Benedict named as Coadjutor Archbishop of Armagh 51-year-old Eamon Martin of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Derry, where he had been serving as diocesan administrator. As coadjutor, [Martin was the Cardinal's chief deputy with right of succession as Metropolitan Archbishop of Armagh on the death or retirement of the Cardinal.

Donal McKeown, the incumbent Bishop of Derry, announced Daly's death and paid tribute, saying that Daly "served, without any concern for himself, throughout the traumatic years of the Troubles, finding his ministry shaped by the experience of witnessing violence and its effects". Public figures including the Irish president, Michael D. Higgins, and his predecessor Mary McAleese paid tribute to Daly's work for peace during the Troubles, as did the leaders of various religious denominations in Derry. Archbishop Eamon Martin, Primate of All Ireland, described Daly as having "literally spent himself in the service of others", and said he will be remembered as "a fearless peacebuilder". According to The Guardian, in its obituary, the abiding memory of Daly is one of "a terrified but calm priest waving a bloodied white handkerchief", which the BBC described as "the iconic image of Bloody Sunday". Daly was never comfortable with the public profile he gained following his actions on Bloody Sunday and did not enjoy his duties as a bishop, particularly disliking the administrative responsibilities that came with the post. He believed he would not have been made Bishop of Derry had it not been for Bloody Sunday, and worried that his other work was overlooked as a result—that he "was the priest with the handkerchief and that was it". He was happier performing pastoral ministry, and felt that the years after his retirement as a bishop—which he spent tending to terminally ill hospice patients—were his "most fulfilling as a priest".

In February 2014 McKeown was appointed by Pope Francis bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Derry and was installed on  6 April 2014 in Saint Eugene's Cathedral. The principal celebrant was accompanied by Sean Cardinal Brady, retired Archbishop of Armagh and former Primate of All Ireland. The principal concelebrants were Charles John Brown apostolic nuncio to Ireland; Eamon Martin, Archbishop of Armagh; Séamus Hegarty, Bishop-emeritus of Derry; Edward Daly, Bishop-emeritus of Derry; Francis Lagan, auxiliary bishop emeritus in the Derry Diocese and Fr.
